intro: Cissampelos subreniformis, commonly known as the kidneyleaf moonvine, is a climbing plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Menispermaceae and is characterized by its heart-shaped leaves and fragrant, yellowish-green flowers. The plant produces small, fleshy fruits that contain seeds enclosed in a white, fleshy pulp. It is often found growing in moist, shaded environments such as forests and along stream banks. Due to its ornamental value and medicinal properties, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens and traditional herbal practices.
